Class ec.util.Humanity 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.util.Humanity
public class Humanity
extends Object
This class collects a bunch of methods which are intended to make computery output more human-friendly.

exceptionToHumanBacktrace(Throwable)
Given an exception, this hands back just the backtrace part, but in a human form.
humanizeBacktrace(String)
This is the official way to take a normal backtrace string (all the lines beginning with "\tat") and turn it into a human-readable form.
humanizeException(Throwable)
This is the official way to take a normal Throwable and turn it into a human-acceptable form.
humanPrintStackTrace(Throwable, PrintStream)
This is like printStackTrace, except it humanizes the exception.

humanizeBacktrace 
 public static String humanizeBacktrace(String trace)
This is the official way to take a normal backtrace string (all the lines beginning with "\tat") and turn it into a human-readable form.

exceptionToHumanBacktrace 
 public static String exceptionToHumanBacktrace(Throwable t)
Given an exception, this hands back just the backtrace part, but in a human form.

humanizeException 
 public static String humanizeException(Throwable t)
This is the official way to take a normal Throwable and turn it into a human-acceptable form.

humanPrintStackTrace 
 public static void humanPrintStackTrace(Throwable t,
                                         PrintStream out)
This is like printStackTrace, except it humanizes the exception.
